title: Bringing the social and ethical responsibilities of computing to the forefront
summary: The Social and Ethical Responsibilities of Computing (SERC) initiative at MIT recently held a symposium to explore the societal and ethical implications of algorithms and artificial intelligence (AI). The symposium showcased a variety of research projects, including the use of digital twins to preserve endangered heritage sites, optimizing organ allocation systems, and addressing biases in algorithms. The panel discussions also touched on the regulation of AI technologies and the role of ethics in computing education. The symposium aimed to foster a deeper understanding of the challenges and opportunities presented by the widespread use of algorithms and AI.
